items.desc: A hopeful post-apocalyptic movie about environmental destruction and the power of nature. One of the best Hayao Miyazaki films.
items.title: Nausicaä of the Valley of the Wind

items.desc: Unparalleled in its animation and storytelling, even 30 years later.
items.title: Akira

items.desc: Fun D&D-style fantasy adventure with a great cast of characters. There a many Slayers TV shows, OVAs, and movies to pick from.
items.title: Slayers

items.desc: A psychological thriller about obsession and identity. Satoshi Kon's best work.
items.title: Perfect Blue

items.desc: Similar in themes to Nausicaä, but with a more mature and complex story.
items.title: Princess Mononoke

items.desc: One of the most wholesome and heartwarming anime series ever made.
items.title: Card Captor Sakura

items.desc: A high school romance with a unique visual style and a focus on character development.
items.title: His and Her Circumstances

items.desc: Dark and gritty with a story focused on the horrors of war and the loss of innocence.
items.title: Now and Then, Here and There

items.desc: The 1996 run of Rurouni Kenshin mostly great with some outstanding traditional animation, however this standalone OVA is what I recommend most. If you like it, there's more Rurouni Kenshin to discover.
items.title: Rurouni Kenshin Trust & Betrayal

items.desc: Along with the sequel, Banner of the Stars, some of the best space opera anime ever made.
items.title: Crest of the Stars

items.desc: My favorite coming of age story in all of anime. Some of the most impressive animation for the time, and a killer soundtrack.
items.title: FLCL

items.desc: Another Satoshi Kon masterpiece, this time about the life of a retired actress.
items.title: Millennium Actress

items.desc: Stylish anime with a unique premise and a suburb soundtrack.
items.title: Read or Die: The OVA

items.desc: The best Ghibli movie, not just one of the best animes ever made but one of the best movies ever made.
items.title: Spirited Away

items.desc: The original 2001 run of Fruits Basket is probably my favorite anime of all time. The 2019 remake is also fantastic, but the original holds a special place in my heart.
items.title: Fruits Basket 2001

items.desc: My favorite work by Kiyohiko Azuma. A slice of life comedy with incredibly endearing characters.
items.title: Azumanga Daioh

items.desc: A fascinating and unique take on the magical girl genre with a soundtrack entirely taken from classical music.
items.title: Princess Tutu

items.desc: My personal favorite Yoshitoshi ABe work. An amazing soundtrack by Kou Otani, of Shadow of the Colossus fame. Like most of my favorite stories it is highly character driven.
items.title: Haibane Renmei

items.desc: Hands down the best world building in all of anime. More than just world building though as there is so much character development in every story arc.
items.title: The 12 Kingdoms

items.desc: A surreal road trip viewed from the perspective of our protagonist, Kino, and their talking (maybe?) motorrad. Each episode is a self-contained story that explores different themes.
items.title: Kino's Journey

items.desc: The most surreal recommendation on this list, and I'm fairly sure it always will be. Animation by my all time favorite animator, Masaaki Yuasa. A story about identity and memory.
items.title: Kaiba

items.desc: My favorite sports anime about the Japanese card game, Karuta. The characters are all so endearing and the story is so well written.
items.title: Chihayafuru

items.desc: Keiichi Arawi's delightful slice of life comedy that is surprising in its depth and character development. Beats out Azumanga Daioh as my favorite slice of life comedy.
items.title: Nichijou

items.desc: I loved the fist season of this show, which is a complete story arc in itself. The show is based on the hilarious premise that the protagonist is so powerful he can defeat any enemy with a single punch.
items.title: One Punch Man

items.desc: One of my favorite directors, Makoto Shinkai, made this beautiful movie about love and time travel.
items.title: Your Name

items.desc: Beautifully animated story with a focus on character development and world building.
items.title: Land of the Lustrous

items.desc: A cute action / comedy series about a group of witches in training. Animation by Studio Trigger, one of my favorite studios.
items.title: Little Witch Academia

items.desc: Another Studio Trigger production headed up by Hiroyuki Imaishi. The use of color and motion in this movie is absolutely stunning.
items.title: Promare

items.desc: This show is on my list only because of the beautiful sakuga the show consistently delivers every season. The story is fine, but the animation is what makes this show worth watching.
items.title: Demon Slayer

items.desc: Just watch the first episode, you will immediately fall in love with the characters and want to know what happens next. I love how much they play with the animation and how it doesn't look like anything else.
items.title: Ranking of Kings

items.desc: From the same people that made Land of the Lustrous. This is CG animation at its absolute peak. I love the story and characters too. The 90s original Trigun is also great, but I would recommend this show first.
items.title: Trigun: Stampede

items.desc: Slice of life love story with extremely well written and likeable characters.
items.title: Skip and Loafer

items.desc: I was surprised at how much I enjoyed this show. The strong character driven story won me over.
items.title: Blue Eye Samurai

items.desc: Note: I need to watch this show all the way through before I can recommend it.
items.title: Scott Pilgrim Takes Off

items.desc: Note: I need to watch this show all the way through before I can recommend it.
items.title: Dandadan
